item.title: Productive Forces, Relations of Production, and Historial Materialism
item.description: Productive Forces, RoP, Historical Progression § [Capitalism] has pitilessly torn asunder the motley feudal ties that bound man to his “natural superiors”, and has left remaining no other nexus between man and man than naked selfinterest, than callous “cash payment”.

item.title: Spontaneous Organization
item.description: Money is an example of spontaneous organization: Devonthink.

item.title: Machine Learning

item.title: Zero Sum Game
item.description: def. Zero Sum Game. When each box in the payoff (cost) matrix sums to zero.

item.title: Consistency
item.description: def. Consisteny. An estimator θ^(X1​,…,Xn​) is consistent for parameter θ if: ∀ϵ>0, θ^ p⟶​n→∞​ θi.e.n→∞lim​P(∣θ^−θ∣<ϵ)=1n→∞lim​P(∣θ^−θ∣>ϵ)=0 ![[スクリーンショット 2023-02-21 15.

item.title: Binomial Distribution
item.description: Binomial Distribution § def. Binomial Distribution. For random variable X which denotes the number of successes within n trials with success probability p: XP(X=k)​∼Binom(n,p)=(kn​)⋅pk⋅(1−p)n−k​ E[X]=np Var[X]=n⋅p(1−p) .

item.description: (DevonThink) > The more precise and niche the words I input, the better the internet would ma… | Hacker News.

item.title: Graph
item.description: def. Graph. A Graph is defined as: Ordered pair (V,E) where V is the set of all vertices E={x,y∣x,y∈V and x=y} Types of Graphs § Variations on: Directed or Undirected Connected or Not Connected Cyclical or Acyclical Common types: Tree is a connected undirected acyclical graph Forest is a set of trees Directed Graph Directed Acyclical Graph Properties of Graphs § Degree of a vertex v∈V: number of edges that connect to v Loop: an edge that connects a vertex to itself Cycle: a path that starts and ends with the same vertex Representation of Graphs in Memory § Adjacency Matrix 2D table of all nodes: Store a 1 if the edge between two nodes exists, 0 otherwise.

item.title: Markov Inequality
item.description: thm. Markov Inequality. For a non-negative random variable X, the following hols for all positive constant a: P(X≥a)≤aE(X)​.
